author: VNExplorer
title: Copa del Rey: ¬°Adi√≥s al campe√≥n! Atl√©tico de Madrid elimina al Real Madrid en 8vos de Final
text:
Madrid, Espa√±a.- El Derbi Madrile√±o que se jug√≥ hoy en la Copa del Rey 2024 vio la celebraci√≥n de los miembros del Atl√©tico de Madrid y la eliminaci√≥n del √∫ltimo monarca del torneo, Real Madrid Club de Futbol, tras perder despu√©s de 120¬¥ minutos en el juego de los Octavos de Final que se celebr√≥ en el estadio Civitas Metropolitano.
Los comandados por el exjugador argentino, Diego Simeone, le tomaron la medida a los ‚ÄòVikingos‚Äô del italiano Carlo Ancelotti para vengarse de su dolorsa derrota en la semifinal de la Supercopa de Espa√±a que se festej√≥ en Arabia Saudita y su vecino la gan√≥ el fin pasado tras golear al FC Barcelona (4-1).
El duelo en Riad era un aviso que en la Copa de su majestad el Rey vendr√≠a una disputa mucho m√°s espectacular que, nuevamente, se defini√≥ hasta los tiempos extra. El Atl√©tico de Madrid estuvo en ventaja con la anotaci√≥n de Samuel Lino (39‚Ä≤), quien apareci√≥ a segundo poste para vencer al portero Andriy Lunin.
Antoine Griezmann devolvi√≥ la ventaja al Atl√©tico Twitter Atl√©tico de Madrid
Antes del descanso el arquero ‚Äòcolchonero‚Äô, Jan Oblak (45‚Ä≤), cometi√≥ una pifia y la pelota termin√≥ en el interior de su arco. En el complemento los rojibllancos retomaron la ventaja con el gol de √Ålvaro Morata (57‚Ä≤), no obstante Real Madrid envi√≥ el duelo a la prorr√≥ga con el empate de Jos√© Luis Mato Sanmart√≠n (82¬¥).
Atl√©tico super√≥ al Madrid en 8vos de Final Twitter Atl√©tico de Madrid
Despu√©s del silbatazo la tensi√≥n se uni√≥ al partido, pues la afici√≥n del Atl√©tico de Madrid viv√≠a con el recuerdo de la Supercopa de Espa√±a, pero los suyos se enfocaron en hacer olvidar ese descalabro con la colaboraci√≥n de su goleador hist√≥rico Antoine Griezmann (100‚Ä≤) y con Rodrigo Riquelme (119¬¥) que coloc√≥ la cereza en el postre. 4-2 oficial
Atl√©tico de Madrid, este jueves, se encargo de dejar fuera al campe√≥n defensor de la Copa del Rey. Ser√° en las siguientes horas cuando conozca a su siguiente sinodal en Cuartos de Final, fase que competir√°n: Sevilla, Athletic Club, R.C.D. Mallorca, Celta de Vigo, Real Sociedad, Girona FC y FC Barcelona tras superar los 4tos de Final del torneo.

author: VNExplorer
title: PM Modi to lay foundation stone of NLC's 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today
text:
PM Modi to lay foundation stone of NLC‚Äôs 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will virtually lay the foundation stone for the 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today, an official statement from the Ministry of Coal said.
The project is being set up with an investment of over Rs 1,756 crore to ensure affordable power supply to government entities.
NLC India Limited, a leading Navratna CPSE under the Ministry of Coal, is establishing the power project in Barsingsar, in Rajasthan‚Äôs Bikaner district, as part of the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy‚Äôs CPSE Scheme.
The project is equipped with cutting-edge technology, including high-efficiency bifacial modules manufactured in India.
The solar project aligns with the Atma Nirbhar Bharat initiative led by Prime Minister Modi.
The electricity generated will be transmitted through the pre-existing power transmission lines of Barsingsar Thermal Power Station, aiming to produce around 750 million units of green power annually, offsetting carbon dioxide emissions by approximately 18,000 million metric tonnes over its lifetime.
The power usage agreement for the project has been inked with Rajasthan Urja Vikas Nigam Limited at a competitive tariff of Rs 2.52 per unit for the next 25 years, the release stated.
The project is slated for commissioning by September 2024, with the potential to create employment opportunities for approximately 600 individuals indirectly during the project phase and 100 personnel during the operations & maintenance phase, it added.
The official statement further said, ‚ÄúFurthermore, this project will enable Rajasthan to fulfil its renewable purchase obligation while contributing to the nation‚Äôs journey towards achieving a net-zero future.‚Äù
NLCIL claims to operate the 250 MW Barsingsar Thermal Power Station (BTPS), providing cost-effective electricity to the state of Rajasthan. The company has secured a 300 MW solar project capacity in the CPSE Scheme Phase-II Tranche-III floated by the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) through competitive bidding.

author: Courtney Francisco
title: 2 Atlanta Army veterans say they are still paying for rental house after tree fell on it ‚Äì WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta
text: ATLANTA ‚Äî Two Atlanta Army veterans are begging for help. [A tree fell on the home they rent during last weeks‚Äô downpours](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/massive-trees-falls-home-atlantas-west-end-neighborhood/BBTLDHKXORA5NCHQEARLCK7NXE/). Now, they tell Channel 2‚Ä≤s Courtney Francisco that they can‚Äôt afford to move out of the soggy, damaged house. [Speaking with Francisco,](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/atlanta-father-jumps-into-action-save-family-after-75-year-old-tree-falls-home/ONVT4GYD2ZBO3IWGYROESWWBMY/) Christman Hampton said after the tree fell on the house, he jumped into action to make sure everyone got out safely. Five days after the tree fell, it‚Äôs been removed from the home. However, a tarp is covering holes in the walls, and a large tree branch remains lodged in the dining room ceiling. ‚ÄúIt was just a tremendous thing, and it happened in the middle of the night, and everyone was scared,‚Äù Velma Robinson said. [DOWNLOAD: [Free WSB-TV News app for alerts as news breaks](https://www.wsbtv.com/smart-tv/)] Now, Robinson‚Äôs fear turns to paying rent from a house with huge holes in it while paying for a new place to stay. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no money to spare at all,‚Äù Robinson said. She and her husband, Christman Hampton, are both Army Veterans. She served in Iraq and Afghanistan and he served in Desert Storm. They were both disabled and live on a fixed income. TRENDING STORIES: [Ga. man who sexually assaulted 12-year-old girl and left her in Walmart parking lot sentenced](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/ga-man-who-sexually-assaulted-12-year-old-girl-left-her-walmart-parking-lot-sentenced/BLOR64VFVVEXHBXNQWNVE435ZM/) [Legislation proposes banning use of Georgia tax dollars for American Library Association, affiliates](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/legislation-proposes-banning-use-georgia-tax-dollars-american-library-association-affiliates/E2F2H2HPLRG65L4SUC2DEQJW7A/) [‚ÄòI can‚Äôt do this anymore‚Äô: Family seeks help after moving into GA home infested by colony of bats](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/i-cant-do-this-anymore-family-seeks-help-after-moving-into-ga-home-infested-by-colony-bats/QPAVP562KVAEXFRQAAFNAS4W3M/) ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know where we can turn,‚Äù Robinson said. The tree fell forward from the backyard of the rental home. Now, the left side of the house needs repairs, the fencing outside and both the front and back yards need cleaning up. Inside, the home also needs cleaning and repairs. Sheetrock and insulation litter the home. Channel 2 Consumer Advisor Clark Howard said landlords should not ask you to pay rent during these type of big repairs. If you do pay rent, they should have a comparable place for you to stay until repairs are complete. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs fair and proper in this situation? The tenant is paying rent for something they cannot use, and it‚Äôs not the tenants‚Äô fault. The landlord has a responsibility to a tenant to either give them a payment holiday on rent until it‚Äôs occupiable, again, give them a place to live until it‚Äôs occupiable again or give them a payment allowance to live somewhere else and they continue to pay rent to the landlord,‚Äù Howard said. He suggests renters in this situation write an e-mail and send a certified letter via the U.S. Postal Service. In that letter, you should list the date the house became unable to be occupied and inform the landlord you need alternate housing or funding to find your own temporary housing. ‚ÄúYou put the shoe on the other foot,‚Äù Howard said. If landlords refuse to work with tenants, the Georgia Landlord-Tenant Handbook says to inform the landlord you will hire contractors to make the repairs and deduct the cost from your rent. You must put this in writing and, ideally, the landlord would agree before you begin repairs. If a home is uninhabitable, you can move out. There is a catch, though. Landlords can still ask you to pay rent for the remainder of the lease and take you to court if you do not pay. A judge will then decide if you need to pay the landlord. In Robinson‚Äôs case, she‚Äôs tired of living under a tarp. She‚Äôs just uneasy about the alternatives. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very stressful to think that we could potentially have nowhere to go,‚Äù Robinson told Channel 2 Action News. The family has [set up a website for private donations](https://www.gofundme.com/f/expense-to-move-after-tree-falls-on-home) to help them move. [SIGN UP: [WSB-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter](https://membercenter.wsbtv.com/newsletters)] IN OTHER NEWS: ¬©2023 Cox Media Group

author: Kaitlyn Hart
title: ‚ÄòQuit shooting at the police.‚Äô As IFPD releases footage from recent officer-involved shooting, chief has stern message.
text:
‚ÄòQuit shooting at the police.‚Äô As IFPD releases footage from recent officer-involved shooting, chief has stern message.Published at | Updated at
IDAHO FALLS ‚Äì The Idaho Falls Police Department released body camera footage Wednesday showing multiple officers‚Äô perspectives during a nerve-wracking shooting incident at the Econo Lodge.
During a press conference Wednesday afternoon, Idaho Falls Police Chief Bryce Johnson went over the footage minute by minute, giving the reasoning behind the officers‚Äô movements during the exchange of gunfire with 45-year-old Robert Flores on April 8.
Johnson identified the officers who fired their guns as Mitch Bierma and Shayden Nagle. Both officers were placed on administrative leave.
Bonneville County Prosecutor announced Wednesday night that Bierma and Nagle had both been cleared of wrongdoing, stating their actions were justified under the circumstances.
‚ÄúThere can be little dispute that officers are acting in self-defense when they return fire at an individual shooting at them, or when they reasonably perceive that an individual presents an imminent threat of death or serious bodily injury to other officers,‚Äù says Neal in the release. ‚ÄúProsecuting Attorney Neal commends these officers for their selfless courage in the line of fire.‚Äù
Video details
The first two minutes of the video have no audio due to a two-minute ‚Äúlook back‚Äù feature on the officers‚Äô body cameras, which enables video to be recorded without audio two minutes before an officer presses record.
In the video, multiple officers arrive around 3 p.m. at the Econo Lodge located at 1448 West Broadway Street after a report from hotel staff that two people were refusing to leave their room after checkout.
Officers learned one of the people involved was Flores and say they took precautionary measures due to his criminal history. There was also a woman believed to be in the room, although she was later discovered to have left before the incident.
A hotel staff member is seen leading six officers to room 112. Officers knock on the door multiple times, announcing themselves as IFPD and asking Flores and the woman to leave the hotel.
According to a news release from IFPD, ‚ÄúSeven Idaho Falls Police officers were involved in the initial response. Six officers were inside the hotel. One was outside, watching the room‚Äôs window. The officers also brought police tools, including a ballistic shield and a police K9.‚Äù
After multiple attempts to convince Flores to leave, officers use a key card to access the room and kick down the door to break the security chain.
Officers find nobody in the bedroom area, but notice the bathroom door is shut.
Police try to communicate with Flores again but do not receive a response. At that point, Bierma and his K9 partner, Argo, move closer to the bathroom door and prepare to send the dog into the bathroom. Another officer and a sergeant are standing near Bierma.
Nagle is on the other side of the bathroom doorway, holding a ballistic shield with two other officers standing behind him in a ‚Äústack‚Äù behind the shield.
Bierma yells to Flores that if he does not come out, he is going to send the K9 into the bathroom, and Flores will get bitten.
As the sergeant goes to open the bathroom door, Flores appears to fire a shot through the door. This shot strikes the center of the ballistic shield being held by Nagle.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just the most vulnerable I‚Äôve ever felt.‚Äù
Bierma, K9 Argo, the sergeant, and a third police officer run into the hallway, with two going one direction and Bierma going the other.
As officers retreat the room in response to the gunfire, K9 Argo bites the sergeant on the arm. Bierma immediately calls Argo off, and the dog runs down the hallway, following the other officers.
The sergeant required medical care for the bite.
Nagle and the two officers with him hide in the far corner of the room, on the side of a bed behind the ballistic shield.
As Nagle and the two other officers are getting the shield in place, Flores allegedly reaches out of the bathroom with a gun held in both hands and points it toward the officers in the room.
Nagle fires three rounds at Flores, which go through the drywall, into the bathroom and strike Flores twice in the abdomen. Flores then appears to shoots twice, missing the officers.
Bierma, from the hallway, also fires two rounds at Flores.
The officers inside the room stay crammed into the corner behind the shield for 23 minutes until they are able to be evacuated through the window.
‚ÄúThroughout the 23 minutes, officers could hear Flores moving, coughing and making other sounds, but he did not respond to officers,‚Äù according to the release. ‚ÄúDuring this time, additional officers responded and evacuated other hotel guests and staff.‚Äù
An unidentified officer is seen visibly shaking and nearly hyperventilating as he tries to calm himself in the back of a SWAT vehicle.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been shot at before,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just the most vulnerable I‚Äôve ever felt.‚Äù
The IFPD SWAT team, Unmanned Aerial Systems (drone) team, Crisis Negotiators, and others were activated to respond during the incident. Through the use of drones and robots, officials were able to tell that Flores was still moving after the officers were evacuated. IFPD used several different methods to try to communicate with Flores with no response.
Around 5:30 p.m. Idaho Falls SWAT officers use a flashbang grenade and enter the room, taking Flores into custody.
‚ÄòQuit pointing guns at them, quit firing bullets at them‚Äô
During the conference, Johnson made a strong and concerted point to humanize his officers, many of whom have been shot at multiple times in their careers, and one who experienced their first gunfire incident at the Econo Lodge.
‚ÄúThis is the third time Idaho Falls Police officers have been shot at in the last five months,‚Äù said Johnson. ‚ÄúOf the seven officers who responded, more than half are veterans who have served the country, and all of them are fathers.‚Äù
Johnson refers to an officer involved shooting on Dec. 4
near the Candlewood Suites Hotel, and another on Jan. 8 in the area of 4th Street and South Lee Avenue.
Bierma, an IFPD officer for nearly nine years, was also at the December shooting, in which the suspect ended up shooting himself and dying in front of the officers.
RELATED | Footage released of officer-involved shooting that left man dead; officers cleared of criminal charges
Bierma is a K9 handler, a position that Johnson says often brings him into the most dangerous and volatile situations.
‚ÄúHe and K9 Argo, who go to the most dangerous calls all the time, have been partners for almost four years,‚Äù says Johnson. ‚ÄúOfficer Bierma is a veteran, a husband and a father.‚Äù
Johnson was clearly emotional when he said Nagle had only been an officer for less than two years and has already been in the line of fire.
‚ÄúHad he not been holding that ballistic shield, that round would have hit him,‚Äù said Johnson. ‚ÄúOfficer Nagle is 23 years old. He is a father of a little baby and he has a new little baby at home.‚Äù
Of the unidentified officers involved, according to Johnson, one is an active member of the Idaho National Guard, and one is a veteran and former ‚Äúbeloved school resource officer at a local middle school.‚Äù
Johnson also critiqued the criminal justice system, saying it needs to learn to keep dangerous criminals behind bars.
Including the incident detailed in this story, Flores has allegedly prompted three SWAT team responses in five months.
RELATED | How has one man caused three IFPD SWAT responses? We looked into it.
‚ÄúWe need to, collectively as an entire criminal justice system, do better at getting some dangerous people off the street and keeping them off the street,‚Äù said Johnson. ‚ÄúI do not have words to express the pride I have in what these Idaho Falls officers do ‚Äî their courage under fire, their extreme restraint when they‚Äôre being shot at, their tactical planning beforehand, their response to try to keep people safe.‚Äù
In a heartfelt statement directed toward recent shooting suspects, Johnson said he and his officers are committed to going above and beyond to safeguard lives, and urges the community to stop aiming guns at officers.
‚ÄúQuit shooting at the police. My officers are doing what they have to do to stay safe. You can watch every one of those videos, and you‚Äôll see in every one, they do everything they can to try to safely take people into custody,‚Äù said Johnson. ‚ÄúQuit pointing guns at them, quit firing bullets at them ‚Äî that‚Äôs what I want to tell them.‚Äù
Additional body camera footage from this incident is available by filing a public records request on the
Idaho Falls Police website.
Flores was treated for his wounds at a local hospital and has been charged with six counts of aggravated assault on law enforcement officers, unlawful possession of a firearm, misdemeanor resisting or obstructing officers, misdemeanor trespassing, and six felony enhancements for the use of a deadly weapon. His preliminary hearing is scheduled for May 1.
He could face up to life in prison if convicted.

author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | Daily Echo
text:
Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit.
Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday.
Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected.
‚ö° We've now restored power to 46k customers #stormgerrit üè† 1.5k will be off overnight, we're giving help & advice.üë∑ Teams are working tonight to clear debris hindering access to faults.‚òï Full details of vans serving hot meals from 9am tomorrow are at https://t.co/HSBcM400Fh pic.twitter.com/pnHIApyUvC
‚Äî Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (@ssencommunity) December 28, 2023
They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am.
Operations director Andy Smith said: ‚ÄúThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I‚Äôm grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.‚Äù
National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck.
Storm Gerrit strongest gusts. See story WEATHER Gerrit. Infographic PA Graphics. An editable version of this graphic is available if required. Please contact graphics@pamediagroup.com. Three men died after their 4√ó4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a ‚Äúlocalised tornado‚Äù in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook.
Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours‚Äô houses ‚Äúare an absolute disaster‚Äù with missing roofs and ‚Äúsquished‚Äù cars.
Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said.
Screengrab taken from PA Video of a damaged gate in Stalybridge after the Tameside tornado (Richard McCarthy/PA) ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults.
Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day.
In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.
üå¶Ô∏è Blustery showers are possible on Friday morning, with these most likely in the north and west. Many of us will also see some sunshine and some places may stay dry.
üå¨Ô∏è Still windy in northern England and later Shetland, with gales possible, but otherwise somewhat less windy. pic.twitter.com/hInP8LNF2c
‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) December 28, 2023
Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel.
Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal.
The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: ‚ÄúHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.‚Äù

author: Jes√∫s Garc√≠a
title: D√≠a Mundial de los Animales: ¬øCu√°l es el origen y la importancia de esta celebraci√≥n? - PorEsto
text: NEWSLETTER POR ESTO! Suscr√≠bete y recibe la informaci√≥n m√°s relevante Volver √öLTIMA HORA Internacional El l√≠der iran√≠, Ali Jamnei asegur√≥ que ataque a Israel fue el "menor de los castigos" Volver Por [ Jes√∫s Garc√≠a ](/autor/jesus-garcia.html) 3 de oct. de 2024 3 min Escrito por [ Jes√∫s Garc√≠a ](/autor/jesus-garcia.html) El D√≠a Mundial de los Animales se celebra cada a√±o el 4 de octubre. Esta fecha fue establecida en 1929 durante un congreso de la Organizaci√≥n Mundial de Protecci√≥n Animal en Viena. Desde entonces, se ha convertido en una ocasi√≥n global para reflexionar sobre la relaci√≥n entre los seres humanos y los animales, y para promover su bienestar. El 4 de octubre fue elegido en honor a San Francisco de As√≠s, el santo patrono de los animales y del medio ambiente en la tradici√≥n cristiana. San Francisco es conocido por su amor y respeto hacia todas las criaturas vivientes, lo que lo convierte en un s√≠mbolo perfecto para esta celebraci√≥n. La primera celebraci√≥n formal del D√≠a Mundial de los Animales tuvo lugar en 1931 durante una convenci√≥n ecologista en Florencia, Italia. Desde entonces, la fecha ha sido adoptada por diversas organizaciones y pa√≠ses para promover la protecci√≥n y el respeto hacia los animales. Cuidar a los animales es crucial por varias razones: Los animales merecen ser tratados con respeto y dignidad. Promover su bienestar refleja nuestros valores √©ticos y compasivos. Tratar bien a los animales tambi√©n puede fomentar una sociedad m√°s emp√°tica y justa. Los animales juegan roles fundamentales en los ecosistemas, como la polinizaci√≥n, el control de plagas y la dispersi√≥n de semillas. La p√©rdida de biodiversidad puede debilitar estos procesos naturales, poniendo en riesgo la salud del planeta y nuestra propia supervivencia. Por ejemplo, los polinizadores como las abejas son esenciales para la producci√≥n de alimentos. Muchas especies est√°n en peligro de extinci√≥n debido a la actividad humana. Proteger a los animales ayuda a preservar la biodiversidad y a mantener el equilibrio ecol√≥gico. La conservaci√≥n de especies tambi√©n puede tener beneficios econ√≥micos, como el ecoturismo, que depende de la existencia de fauna silvestre. En M√©xico, varios animales est√°n en peligro de extinci√≥n en 2024, incluyendo: Este peque√±o cet√°ceo es uno de los mam√≠feros marinos m√°s amenazados del mundo. Su poblaci√≥n ha disminuido dr√°sticamente debido a la pesca ilegal con redes de enmalle. En 2024, se estima que quedan alrededor de 10 ejemplares. A pesar de los esfuerzos de conservaci√≥n, la vaquita marina sigue enfrentando amenazas significativas. Un anfibio end√©mico de M√©xico, conocido por su capacidad de regeneraci√≥n. El ajolote enfrenta amenazas por la p√©rdida de h√°bitat y la contaminaci√≥n del agua. Recientemente, se han llevado a cabo esfuerzos para reintroducir ajolotes criados en laboratorio en su h√°bitat natural en Xochimilco. El mayor felino de Am√©rica, cuya poblaci√≥n ha disminuido debido a la p√©rdida de h√°bitat y la caza furtiva. Los jaguares son cruciales para mantener el equilibrio en los ecosistemas. En M√©xico, se han implementado programas de conservaci√≥n en √°reas protegidas como la Selva Lacandona y la Reserva de la Biosfera de Calakmul. Recientemente, se encontr√≥ un jaguar decapitado en las costas de Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche, lo que ha generado gran preocupaci√≥n y ha llamado la atenci√≥n sobre la necesidad urgente de proteger a esta especie. Una especie de tortuga marina que enfrenta amenazas por la pesca incidental y la contaminaci√≥n. En los √∫ltimos a√±os, se ha reportado la muerte de cientos de tortugas caguama en el Golfo de Ulloa, Baja California Sur. La protecci√≥n de estas especies es vital para mantener la biodiversidad y el equilibrio de los ecosistemas en M√©xico. Adem√°s, cada especie tiene un valor intr√≠nseco y su p√©rdida representa una disminuci√≥n de la riqueza natural del pa√≠s. JGH NEWSLETTER POR ESTO! Suscr√≠bete y recibe la informaci√≥n m√°s relevante Suscr√≠bete a: 02

author: AFP
title: Pyongyang qualifie d'"imprudente" la vente d'h√©licopt√®res am√©ricains √† S√©oul : Actualit√©s - Orange
text: Pyongyang qualifie d'"imprudente" la vente d'h√©licopt√®res am√©ricains √† S√©oul ¬© Wojtek RADWANSKI, AFP - Les Etats-Unis ont annonc√© lundi avoir approuv√© la vente de jusqu'√† 36 h√©licopt√®res d'attaque Apache, ainsi que du mat√©riel li√©, √† la Cor√©e du Sud pour un total d'environ 3,5 milliards de dollars La Cor√©e du Nord a qualifi√© jeudi d'acte "imprudent et provocant" la vente par les Am√©ricains d'h√©licopt√®res Apache √† la Cor√©e du Sud, affirmant qu'elle y r√©pondrait par un renforcement de son propre arsenal. "Il s'agit d'un acte imprudent et provocant" qui vise √† "d√©lib√©r√©ment augmenter l'instabilit√© s√©curitaire dans la r√©gion", a fustig√© dans un communiqu√© le minist√®re de la D√©fense nord-cor√©en. "Nous nous opposons fermement (...) au renforcement militaire (...) des forces vassales" des Etats-Unis, a-t-il d√©clar√©, critiquant par la m√™me des ventes r√©centes am√©ricaines au Japon et √† d'autres alli√©s de Washington en Asie-Pacifique. Les Etats-Unis ont annonc√© lundi avoir approuv√© la vente de jusqu'√† 36 h√©licopt√®res d'attaque Apache, ainsi que du mat√©riel li√©, dont des missiles, √† la Cor√©e du Sud pour un total d'environ 3,5 milliards de dollars (3,1 milliards d'euros). Selon l'agence am√©ricaine pour la coop√©ration en mati√®re de d√©fense (DSCA), elle doit permettre "d'am√©liorer les capacit√©s de la R√©publique de Cor√©e (nom officiel de la Cor√©e du Sud) √† faire face aux menaces actuelles et futures" avec "une force capable de dissuader les adversaires". La transaction doit encore √™tre valid√©e par le Congr√®s am√©ricain avant d'√™tre effective. Cet accord va amener Pyongyang √† "renforcer encore" ses propres moyens de "dissuasion strat√©gique", a soulign√© vendredi le r√©gime nord-cor√©en. L'annonce de la vente est intervenue au premier jour des traditionnels exercices militaires annuels men√©s conjointement par Washington et S√©oul. Baptis√©es "Ulchi Freedom Shield", elles mobiliseront des milliers de militaires jusqu'au 29 ao√ªt. Washington est le principal alli√© de S√©oul en mati√®re de s√©curit√©. publi√© le 23 ao√ªt √† 01h42, AFP

author: Bloomberg
title: Heredera de conglomerado franc√©s se convierte en la primera mujer en amasar una fortuna de m√°s de US$100 mil millones
text: Heredera de conglomerado franc√©s se convierte en la primera mujer en amasar una fortuna de m√°s de US$100 mil millones El creciente dominio franc√©s del mercado del lujo ha impulsado las riquezas de varias familias millonarias, incluido el clan a cargo de Hermes International, considerada la mayor fortuna familiar de Europa - T+ - T- Seg√∫n el √≠ndice de multimillonarios de Bloomberg, este jueves, la fortuna de Fran√ßoise Bettencourt Meyers ascendi√≥ a US$ 100.200 millones, luego de que las acciones de L¬¥Oreal subieran a un nivel r√©cord. La compa√±√≠a de productos de belleza, fundada por su abuelo, Eugene Schueller, registr√≥ un m√°ximo hist√≥rico y se prepara a cerrar su mejor a√±o desde 1998. De este modo, Bettencourt, de 70 a√±os, se convirti√≥ en la primera mujer en ser due√±a de un patrimonio de m√°s de US$ 100 mil millones. Pese a los altos niveles de ganancias para la heredera de la cosm√©tica francesa, el valor de su fortuna sigue siendo significativamente menor que la de su compatriota y fundador de Mo√´t Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH), Bernard Arnault. Seg√∫n las cifras del ranking mundial, Arnault es la segunda persona m√°s rica del mundo, con US$ 179.400 millones. El creciente dominio franc√©s del mercado del lujo ha impulsado las riquezas de varias familias millonarias, incluido el clan a cargo de Hermes International, considerada la mayor fortuna familiar de Europa, y los hermanos Wertheimer, due√±os de Chanel. Bettencourt es vicepresidenta de la junta directiva de L'Or√©al, una empresa global de US$ 268 mil millones en la que ella y su familia son los mayores accionistas con una participaci√≥n de casi 35%. Sus hijos, Jean-Victor Meyers y Nicolas Meyers, tambi√©n son directores. La heredera mantiene su vida privada al margen, evitando la ostentosa vida social que buscan la mayor√≠a de los multimillonarios. Sin embargo, ha escrito dos libros: un estudio de cinco vol√∫menes de la Biblia y una genealog√≠a de los dioses griegos. Tambi√©n es conocida por tocar el piano todos los d√≠as.

author: RTL info avec BELGA
title: Apr√®s AstraZeneca, un autre groupe renonce √† son vaccin anti-Covid: "Les derni√®res doses ont expir√© fin janvier" | RTL Info
text: Partager: Apr√®s le britannique AstraZeneca, c'est au tour de Sanofi de renoncer √† son vaccin anti-Covid. Le groupe fran√ßais commercialisera d√©sormais celui de son concurrent am√©ricain Novavax, qu'il va aussi tenter de combiner avec ses vaccins contre la grippe. "Les derni√®res doses de VidPrevtyn Beta", le vaccin anti-Covid de Sanofi, "ont expir√© √† la fin du mois de janvier 2024", a indiqu√© vendredi le g√©ant fran√ßais dans un mail √† l'AFP. "Nous avons retir√© la demande d'autorisation de mise sur le march√© de l'Organisation mondiale de la Sant√© (OMS)". "Cette d√©cision n'est pas li√©e √† des probl√®mes d'efficacit√©, de s√©curit√© ou de qualit√©, mais simplement au fait qu'il existe une offre suffisante d'autres vaccins Covid-19 dans le monde", a pr√©cis√© Sanofi. Cette d√©cision marque une nouvelle √©tape dans la gestion de l'apr√®s-pand√©mie par le secteur pharmaceutique. Les principaux groupes sont, en effet, confront√©s √† un net d√©clin des ventes de vaccins anti-Covid. Juste avant Sanofi, le britannique AstraZeneca avait annonc√© mercredi le retrait de son vaccin, l'un des premiers mis sur le march√© pendant la pand√©mie, citant une chute de la demande. Le cas de Sanofi, dont le vaccin avait, lui, tard√© √† arriver sur le march√©, est toutefois un peu diff√©rent, puisque le fran√ßais va r√©cup√©rer l'exploitation d'un autre vaccin anti-Covid, celui de l'am√©ricain Novavax. Les deux groupes ont conclu "un accord de licence co-exclusif pour la co-commercialisation d'un vaccin Covid-19 et le d√©veloppement de vaccins combin√©s grippe-Covid-19", ont-ils annonc√© vendredi dans un communiqu√© commun. Cet accord, qui verra Sanofi verser au moins 500 millions de dollars et jusqu'√† 1,2 milliard √† Novavax, pr√©voit que le premier commercialisera √† partir de 2025 le vaccin du second. Le fran√ßais g√©rera aussi des enjeux de r√©glementation, ainsi que de recherche et d√©veloppement. [vaccin covid-19](/353979/free-tags/vaccin-covid-19)
